section.title: What is &productnameshort;?
section.para: The &productname; (&productnameshort;) is a lightweight operating system. Its stability and software consistence is ensured by a read-only root file system modified by transactional updates. Instead of applications distributed in traditional software packages, it runs containerized and virtualized workloads.

section.title: Core components of &productnameshort;
section.para: The &productname; (&productnameshort;) consists of the following components:

listitem.para: The core of &productnameshort; which runs all required services. It is an immutable operating system with a read-only root file system. The file system is modified by transactional updates which utilize the snapshotting feature of BTRFS.

The &tr-up; command performs changes on the file system. You can use it, for example, to install new software or apply software patches. Because it uses file system snapshots, applied changes can be easily rolled back.

&productnameshort; runs containerized workloads instead of applications packed in software packages. The default container orchestrator in &productnameshort; is &podman; which is responsible for managing containers and container images.
Workloads replace traditional applications. A containerized workload contains all software dependencies required to run a specific application or tool.

A Web-based graphical interface to administer single or multiple &productnameshort; workloads from one place. It helps you manage, for example, user accounts, network settings, or container orchestration.

section.title: Benefits of &productnameshort;
section.para: The &productname; offers the following customer benefits:

listitem.para: Minimal maintenance with keeping the workloads up to date.
Stable immutable base operating system that utilizes transactions when modifying the file system.
Ability to roll back modifications on the file system in case the transaction result is undesirable.
